result.execSummary:
The defendant Efren Ortiz Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay a $300.00 fine plus all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, provide DNA sample and pay costs by 03-21-2016, failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.
with credit for 1 day. TIME SERVED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Efren Ortiz Lopez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Efren Ortiz Lopez in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Alexandria Wirth.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1) with DONESTIC ABUSE enhanver 968.075(1)(a), a Class B misdemeanor.
To the amended charge:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing proceeded.    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 1 day in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 day time served.    The court orders defendant to pay a $300.00 fine plus all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges , provide DNA sample and pay costs by 3-21-2016, failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.
Defendant Efren Ortiz Lopez in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  VIcki Bermudez.  Case remains in trial posture.

Defendant Efren Ortiz Lopez in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Ruth Garcia. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:16 am.

Defendant Efren Ortiz Lopez in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for Elizabeth Longo for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling Conference held off the record. Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Defense counsel to explore a possible deferred prosecution agreement.  Case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 38 on 8-14-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEBORAH R., HER RESIDENCE, AND HER FAMILY.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping. HER

Defendant Efren Ortiz Lopez in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Efren Ortiz Lopez in custody.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
